column1: # 32-Bit Addressing Forms with the ModR/M Byte, Intel Vol2A, Table 2-2

column3: A SIB follows the ModR/M byte.
Denotes a 32-bit displacement that follows the ModR/M byte
(or the SIB byte if one is present) and that is added to the index.
Denotes an 8-bit displacement that follows the ModR/M byte
(or the SIB byte if one is present) and that is sign-extended and added to the index.
